title: Oppo Find N2 Flip Review: This Is How The Future Folds
description: Oppo has launched the Find 2 Flip folding smartphone into the global market. I've spent time with the flip phone to find out how Oppo is challenging the premium market space with its new technology.

title: Arm’s Growing Cloud Server Momentum
description: Mr. Schadt, CEO of Liftr Insights, told me that Arm-based offerings in the public cloud increased by an incredible 290% in 2022.

title: Extensively Drug-Resistant Shigellosis Has Risen This Much Since 2015, CDC Warns
description: On February 24, the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) issued a warning through its CDC Health Alert Network.

title: A Psychologist Suggests 2 Ways To Not Let Your Anger Take Control Of You
description: Here are two tips to follow if you have a short fuse.

title: Eyes Forward: Ballet Dancers’ Clever Trick To Balance Their Turns
description: A new research study confirmed that ballet dancers are better at making many fast turns in a row if they have a visual reference to keep their eyes on.

title: Solar Flare And Explosions May Bring Bright Aurora And Geomagnetic Storms Monday
description: An explosive series of events on the surface of the sun could bring northern lights (and maybe some southern lights, too) to millions over the next couple days, while causing headaches from some radio and satellite operators.

title: Elon Musk Calls Media ‘Racist’ In Response To Newspapers Dropping Dilbert
description: Twitter CEO Elon Musk called the media “racist” in several tweets on Sunday in a strange reaction to the news that the country’s biggest newspapers were dropping the Dilbert comic strip.

title: Last Mile Delivery, Visibility, And Vehicle Capacity
description: One of the most difficult and expensive aspects of the supply chain is last mile delivery. But is also critical to a company's brand. The survey results from APQC provide a cross-industry perspective on last-mile logistics.

title: Covid Likely Originated From Lab Leak, Energy Department Reportedly Finds—But Biden Aide Says There’s No ‘Definitive Answer’
description: National Security Advisor Jake Sullivan said there is “not a definitive answer" on the virus’ origins, as two federal agencies say the virus likely emerged from a laboratory rather than through natural transmission.

title: Lauren Boebert, George Santos Co-Sponsor Bill To Make AR-15 The ‘National Gun’
description: Rep. Barry Moore (R-Alabama) introduced the bill on February 17, 2023.

title: ‘The Last Of Us’ Seems Like It’s Changing Ellie In A Significant Way
description: Tonight, we will get some of Ellie’s backstory in Left Behind, a Neil Druckmann-directed episode of The Last of Us based on DLC from the first game.

title: A Psychologist Offers Two Routes To A Healthier Attachment Style
description: Do not let your attachment issues define the course of your relationship.

title: Ant-Man: Quantumania’s MODOK And His Horrifying Face Go Viral
description: This week, Marvel has decided to unleash a new series of character posters for Ant-Man And The Wasp: Quantumania, including many of its sub-characters. That also includes secondary villain MODOK, played by Corey Stoll, who was only glimpsed in trailers, but now that he’s been fully revealed to—

title: Renault Investors Like Results, Dividend Restoration And Nissan Alliance Changes
description: Renault's share price is still riding high after changes to the alliance with Nissan, an update to its strategic plan and its latest financial results, although it still must grapple with expected sales weakness in its core European market.

title: Clean Air Can Boost Children’s Lung Capacity
description: In a recent study, a group of Sweden-based researchers found that in Stockholm, as air pollution levels started declining since the early 2000s, children and adolescents had improved lung capacity.

title: Will Sony PSVR 2 Ever Work With PC?
description: Reviews tend to praise the quality of the hardware while at times showing reticence to say the headset is worth it when it is unclear how large a library of games PSVR2 is likely to get.

title: WB Has Been Trying To Make A ‘Suicide Squad’ Game For 13 Years, And This Is Where We Landed
description: As everyone tries to figure out what on earth to make of Suicide Squad: Kill the Justice League, a game that just headlined PlayStation’s State of Play, it may be useful to dive into its history a little bit.

title: Netflix’s ‘Outer Banks’ Season 3 Is Not Good
description: Not that Outer Banks was ever some pinnacle of television, but it was a decently fun show, though as we reach season 3 here, that fun has mostly evaporated, and I’m not sure I even want this show to come back for a fourth season now.

title: Legal Doomsday For Generative AI ChatGPT If Caught Plagiarizing Or Infringing, Warns AI Ethics And AI Law
description: Many people do not know that generative AI such as ChatGPT was data trained by scanning the Internet, which is an approach that some believe unfairly usurps the work of human content creators. Here's a close look at the claims of plagiarizing and copyright infringement.

title: Warning: Don’t Pre-Load ‘Destiny 2: Lightfall,’ Which Has Gone Live Early
description: The good news is that you can pre-load Destiny 2’s Lightfall expansion a day early, as it’s been pushed live by accident in some regions. The bad news is it will kill your ability to play the game right now.

title: ‘The Art Of Demon Slayer’ Book Review: A Wonderful Record Of Koyoharu Gotouge’s Immense Talent
description: With 'Demon Slayer' being the cultural phenomenon that it is, its artistic prowess is somewhat taken for granted. However, this very lovely artbook does a very good job of correcting that oversight.

title: The Spectrum Of IT Partnerships
description: Technology vendors build software applications, suites, tools & platforms to clinch sales deals with customers who pay them for their products, services and ongoing support and maintenance. The vendor is the seller and the purchasing organization is the customer. It’s that simple. Except not always.

title: Software Ate The World, But Not In The Way We Assume
description: Five ways Agile thinking has upended our corporate cultures. workplaces, and entire economy.

title: OWC’s All-In-One Thunderbolt Go Dock For Power Users On The Move
description: This beautiful and well made dock from OWC has everything a power user needs to extend a laptop into a fully-fledged workstation.

title: Apple Hardware Will Change The Face of Consumer Healthcare
description: The company has developed an entire healthcare ecosystem.

title: Today’s Wordle #617 Hint, Clues And Answer For Sunday, February 26th
description: Hints and clues to help you with today's Wordle.

title: Today’s ‘Heardle’ Answer And Clues For Sunday, February 26
description: Here's today's 'Heardle' song, along with some hints.

title: Today’s ‘Quordle’ Answers And Clues For Sunday, February 26
description: Some hints and the solution for today's 'Quordle' are just ahead.

title: See The New Map Of One Billion Galaxies That Took Six Years To Create
description: The Legacy Surveys to create the most comprehensive map of the sky possible has used one petabyte (1,000 trillion bytes) of data and 100 million CPU hours.
